intro: Disynaphia ligulifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed disynaphia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. It typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. Disynaphia ligulifolia is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saltwater environments.
